Implementation approach: We will develop a snake game in Python using Pygame for graphics and user input handling. The focus will be on providing smooth gameplay with clear visual feedback and an engaging experience.
Data structures and interfaces:
classDiagram
    class Game {
        -width: int
        -height: int
        -snake: Snake
        -food: Food
        +__init__(width: int, height: int)
        +run() None
        +check_collision() bool
        +place_food() None
    }
    class Snake {
        -segments: list[tuple[int, int]]
        -direction: tuple[int, int]
        +__init__(start_pos: tuple[int, int], start_direction: tuple[int, int])
        +move(direction: tuple[int, int]) None
        +grow() None
    }
    class Food {
        -position: tuple[int, int]
        +__init__() None
        +randomize_position(snake_segments: list[tuple[int, int]]) None
    }
    Game --> Snake
    Game --> Food
Program call flow:
sequenceDiagram
    participant Main as main.py
    participant G as Game
    participant S as Snake
    participant F as Food
    main.py->>G: __init__(width, height)
    G->>S: __init__(start_pos, start_direction)
    G->>F: __init__()
    loop Gameplay Loop
        G->>S: move(direction)
        S-->>G: 
        opt Snake eats food
            G->>S: grow()
            S-->>G: 
            G->>F: randomize_position(snake_segments)
            F-->>G: position
        end
        G->>G: check_collision()
    end
